    • Constructor Detail

      • Name

        public Name()
        Constructor for objects of class Name

      • Name

        public Name(java.lang.String first,
            java.lang.String last,
            java.lang.String middle)
        Non-default constructor. Allows for initialization of all object attributes.
        Parameters:
        first - a person's given name; if null, fails validation
        middle - a person's middle name [optional: use null to declare 'no middle name']
        last - a person's surname; if null, fails validation

    • Method Detail

      • getFirstName

        public java.lang.String getFirstName()
        Modified accessor.
        Returns:
        the Proper Noun version of the underlying first (name) attribute

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName()
        Exposure pattern: presents a public version of makePrettyName.
        Returns:
        "first middle last" OR "first last" if middle name is null

      • getInitials

        public java.lang.String getInitials()
        Abbreviate makePrettyName down to the first letters of all the component names.
        Returns:
        "A. B. C." where A is the first letter of the first name, etc.

      • getLastName

        public java.lang.String getLastName()
        Modified accessor.
        Returns:
        the Proper Noun version of the underlying last (name) attribute

      • getMiddleName

        public java.lang.String getMiddleName()
        Modified accessor.
        Returns:
        the Proper Noun version of the underlying middle (name) attribute

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String first,
                java.lang.String middle,
                java.lang.String last)
        Similar to how it was done in Date, code that is common to re-naming was moved into this mutator of all the attributes. Specifically, if any one name of the three fails validation (length restrictions), all three will be devolved into a preset default.
        Parameters:
        first - a person's given name; if null, fails validation
        middle - a person's middle name [optional: use null to declare 'no middle name']
        last - a person's surname; if null, fails validation

      • setFirstName

        public void setFirstName(java.lang.String first)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        first - given name of a person; null will fail validation

      • setLastName

        public void setLastName(java.lang.String last)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        last - family name (a.k.a. the 'surname') of a person

      • setMiddleName

        public void setMiddleName(java.lang.String middle)
        Mutator.
        Parameters:
        middle - middle name of a person [optional: use null to represent 'no middle name']
